tutorials.title: Welcome to FlowState
tutorials.description: Get started with your personal productivity companion

content.introduction: Welcome to FlowState! This tutorial will help you understand the core features and get you started on your productivity journey.

sections.title: What is FlowState?
sections.content: FlowState is a comprehensive productivity app that helps you manage tasks, track your mood, build habits, and gain insights into your productivity patterns. It's designed to adapt to your workflow and help you achieve optimal focus.

sections.title: Key Features
sections.content:
‚Ä¢ Task Management with smart prioritization
‚Ä¢ Mood tracking and correlation analysis
‚Ä¢ Habit building with streak protection
‚Ä¢ Analytics dashboard with insights
‚Ä¢ Smart notifications that learn from your patterns

sections.title: Getting Started
sections.content:
1. Create your first task
2. Log your mood for the day
3. Set up a daily habit
4. Explore the analytics dashboard
5. Customize your notification preferences

tips: Start with just 2-3 tasks to avoid overwhelm
Log your mood consistently for better insights
Use the streak protection feature wisely

tutorials.title: Task Management Essentials
tutorials.description: Master the art of organizing and prioritizing your tasks

content.introduction: Effective task management is the foundation of productivity. Learn how to create, organize, and prioritize tasks in FlowState.

sections.title: Creating Tasks
sections.content:
Tasks in FlowState are more than simple to-dos. Each task includes:
‚Ä¢ Title and description
‚Ä¢ Priority level (low, medium, high, urgent)
‚Ä¢ Due dates and time estimates
‚Ä¢ Project association
‚Ä¢ Status tracking

sections.title: Priority Levels
sections.content:
‚Ä¢ Urgent: Must be done today
‚Ä¢ High: Important and time-sensitive
‚Ä¢ Medium: Regular daily tasks
‚Ä¢ Low: Nice to have, no immediate deadline

sections.title: Best Practices
sections.content:
1. Use descriptive titles
2. Set realistic due dates
3. Break large tasks into smaller subtasks
4. Review and adjust priorities daily
5. Use the completion rate analytics to improve

tips: Limit urgent tasks to 2-3 per day
Use the two-minute rule: if it takes less than 2 minutes, do it now
Review your task list every morning

tutorials.title: Understanding Mood Tracking
tutorials.description: Learn how mood affects productivity and how to track it effectively

content.introduction: Your emotional state significantly impacts your productivity. Learn how to track your mood and understand its correlation with your performance.

sections.title: The 5-Point Scale
sections.content:
FlowState uses a simple 5-point mood scale:
üò¢ Very Sad (1) - Feeling down, unmotivated
üòî Sad (2) - Below average, some challenges
üòê Neutral (3) - Average day, neither good nor bad
üòä Happy (4) - Good mood, positive energy
üòÑ Very Happy (5) - Excellent mood, highly energized

sections.title: When to Log
sections.content:
‚Ä¢ Morning: How you start the day
‚Ä¢ Midday: Check-in during lunch
‚Ä¢ Evening: Reflect on the day
‚Ä¢ After completing important tasks
‚Ä¢ During mood changes

sections.title: Adding Context
sections.content:
Always add notes to your mood entries:
‚Ä¢ What influenced your mood?
‚Ä¢ Specific events or interactions
‚Ä¢ Physical factors (sleep, exercise, food)
‚Ä¢ Work-related stressors or wins

tips: Be honest with your mood ratings
Look for patterns in your mood calendar
Use mood data to optimize your schedule
nextSteps: Log your mood for 7 consecutive days

tutorials.title: Achieving Flow State
tutorials.description: Techniques to enter and maintain deep focus periods

content.introduction: Flow state is a mental state of complete immersion in an activity. Learn how to achieve and maintain this optimal performance state.

sections.title: What is Flow State?
sections.content:
Flow state is characterized by:
‚Ä¢ Complete focus on the task at hand
‚Ä¢ Loss of self-consciousness
‚Ä¢ Transformation of time perception
‚Ä¢ Intrinsic motivation
‚Ä¢ Effortless concentration
‚Ä¢ Optimal performance

sections.title: Conditions for Flow
sections.content:
1. Clear goals and immediate feedback
2. Balance between challenge and skill level
3. Elimination of distractions
4. Proper environment setup
5. Adequate energy and focus

sections.title: Techniques to Enter Flow
sections.content:
‚Ä¢ Start with a clear intention
‚Ä¢ Use the Pomodoro Technique
‚Ä¢ Create rituals and cues
‚Ä¢ Minimize interruptions
‚Ä¢ Choose optimal challenge level
‚Ä¢ Practice mindfulness meditation

tips: Track when you naturally enter flow states
Identify your peak focus hours
Protect your flow time from interruptions
nextSteps: Set up your ideal work environment

tutorials.title: Building Unbreakable Habits
tutorials.description: Master the science of habit formation and streak maintenance

content.introduction: Habits are the compound interest of self-improvement. Learn how to build lasting habits and maintain long streaks.

sections.title: The Habit Loop
sections.content:
Every habit consists of:
‚Ä¢ Cue: The trigger that starts the habit
‚Ä¢ Routine: The behavior itself
‚Ä¢ Reward: The benefit you get from the habit
‚Ä¢ Tracking: Monitoring your progress

sections.title: Streak Protection System
sections.content:
FlowState offers streak protection:
‚Ä¢ 3 protections per month
‚Ä¢ Use when life gets in the way
‚Ä¢ Reset on the 1st of each month
‚Ä¢ Save your longest streaks
‚Ä¢ Strategic use prevents discouragement

sections.title: Building Strong Habits
sections.content:
1. Start incredibly small
2. Anchor to existing habits
3. Celebrate immediately after
4. Track consistently
5. Focus on identity change
6. Plan for obstacles

tips: Never break the chain twice in a row
Use implementation intentions: 'When X, then Y'
Make bad habits harder and good habits easier
nextSteps: Choose one habit to focus on for 30 days

tutorials.title: Reading Your Analytics
tutorials.description: Understand your productivity patterns and make data-driven improvements

content.introduction: Your analytics dashboard contains powerful insights about your productivity patterns. Learn how to interpret and act on this data.

sections.title: Key Metrics
sections.content:
‚Ä¢ Completion Rate: Percentage of tasks completed
‚Ä¢ Mood Average: Your emotional baseline
‚Ä¢ Streak Length: Consistency in habits
‚Ä¢ Active Time: Time spent on productive activities
‚Ä¢ Trend Analysis: Direction of improvement

sections.title: Correlation Analysis
sections.content:
The mood-productivity correlation shows:
‚Ä¢ Positive correlation: Better mood = higher productivity
‚Ä¢ Negative correlation: Higher productivity during tough times
‚Ä¢ No correlation: Mood and productivity are independent
‚Ä¢ Use this to optimize your schedule

sections.title: Actionable Insights
sections.content:
1. Identify your peak productivity hours
2. Understand mood patterns
3. Find optimal task distribution
4. Spot procrastination patterns
5. Adjust goals based on trends
6. Plan around low-energy periods

tips: Review analytics weekly, not daily
Look for patterns over at least 2 weeks
Use insights to adjust your systems, not to judge yourself
nextSteps: Set up a weekly analytics review

tutorials.title: Advanced Time Management
tutorials.description: Master sophisticated time management techniques for peak productivity

content.introduction: Take your time management to the next level with advanced techniques used by high performers.

sections.title: Time Blocking
sections.content:
Time blocking involves:
‚Ä¢ Assigning specific time slots to tasks
‚Ä¢ Batching similar activities
‚Ä¢ Protecting focus time
‚Ä¢ Planning buffer periods
‚Ä¢ Color-coding by priority or project

sections.title: Energy Management
sections.content:
Align tasks with energy levels:
‚Ä¢ High energy: Creative and challenging work
‚Ä¢ Medium energy: Routine tasks and meetings
‚Ä¢ Low energy: Administrative work and planning
‚Ä¢ Track your energy patterns in FlowState

sections.title: The 4 Ds Framework
sections.content:
For every task, decide to:
1. Do: Important and urgent
2. Defer: Important but not urgent
3. Delegate: Urgent but not important
4. Delete: Neither important nor urgent

tips: Batch similar tasks together
Use your analytics to find optimal work patterns
Plan your week during low-energy periods
nextSteps: Create a time-blocked schedule for next week
Track your energy levels for 7 days

tutorials.title: Smart Notification Setup
tutorials.description: Configure notifications that enhance rather than interrupt your flow

content.introduction: Notifications can make or break your productivity. Learn how to set up FlowState's smart notification system for optimal focus.

sections.title: Smart Learning
sections.content:
FlowState learns from your patterns:
‚Ä¢ When you typically complete tasks
‚Ä¢ Your most productive hours
‚Ä¢ How you respond to different notification times
‚Ä¢ Optimal timing for different task types

sections.title: Notification Types
sections.content:
‚Ä¢ Task reminders: Based on due dates and priorities
‚Ä¢ Habit prompts: Timed for maximum compliance
‚Ä¢ Streak alerts: When you're at risk of breaking streaks
‚Ä¢ Mood check-ins: Gentle reminders to log your mood
‚Ä¢ Achievement celebrations: Positive reinforcement

sections.title: Customization Options
sections.content:
1. Set quiet hours for deep work
2. Choose notification sensitivity
3. Enable/disable smart learning per habit
4. Customize message tone and content
5. Set maximum notifications per day

tips: Start with conservative notification settings
Give the system 2 weeks to learn your patterns
Regularly review and adjust based on effectiveness
nextSteps: Enable smart learning for one habit
